definition: to put oneself in sb else's shoes
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Before the interview, put yourself in the interviewer's shoes to see things from their perspective。
sentences.chinese: 在面试前，设身处地的从面试官的角度去看问题。

sentences.english: Learn from them; live in their shoes; and befriend them.
sentences.chinese: 向他们学习，设身处地，待之如友。

sentences.english: Put yourself in their shoes and try to understand why they think the way they do.
sentences.chinese: 设身处地的去理解别人的苦衷和做法。

sentences.english: You just can't picture it from the inside.
sentences.chinese: 只是不设身处地从第一人称想象。

sentences.english: You never really know a man until you stand in his shoes.
sentences.chinese: 你只有在设身处地的时候才会真正了解一个人。

sentences.english: Before the interview, put yourself in the interviewer's shoes to see things from their perspective.
sentences.chinese: 在面试前，设身处地的从面试官的角度去看问题。

sentences.english: If you put yourself in his position, you would understand his choice.
sentences.chinese: 如果你设身处地为他想想，你就会理解他的选择了。

sentences.english: But I’m guessing that it was all much less funny for you at the time.
sentences.chinese: 但我猜对你设身处地的那个时代不见得有多大的趣味。

sentences.english: To be able to correlate one's own feelings with those of others may be the way to approach humaneness.
sentences.chinese: 能设身处地换位思维，可以说是找到了成仁的方法”。

definition: to put oneself in sb else's shoes (idiom)
to give thought (to others)/to consider (other people's needs)/also pr. [zhao2 xiang3]
What you don't want done to you, don't do to others. (idiom, from the Confucian analects)/Do as you would be done by./Do not do to others what you would not have them do to you.
pinyin: ji3 suo3 bu4 yu4 , wu4 shi1 yu2 ren2

definition: to empathize/to allow (for sth)/to show understanding/to appreciate
genuine and sincere (idiom)/wholehearted
an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
pinyin: dang1 ju2 zhe3 mi2 , pang2 guan1 zhe3 qing1

definition: to ask oneself honestly/to search in one's heart
to experience/to observe
to resolve a difficult situation and leave worries behind (idiom)
multistation
an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
heart and soul/wholeheartedly
to estimate/to surmise/to appraise
selfish/selfishness
to give one's bare heart into sb else's keeping (idiom); sb has one's absolute confidence/to trust completely/to confide in sb with entire sincerity
to act impetuously (idiom); on an impulse
